comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I gather there is also a surname 'Fullaway', which I thought might be a possibility...alas, neither 'Tullaway' nor 'Fullaway' loom large on the NSW BDMs (they don't actually loom at all!)...there was a US entomologist David Timmins Fullaway (1880-1965), from Hawaii, who attended a science conference in Sydney in 1923, but just going on this pic (taken in later life) I can't see a likeness...so I've crossed him off my list...see port on p. 260... scholarspace.manoa.hawaii.edu/bitstream/handle/10125/1092... Wonder if he might have been related to this chap...there's a slight resemblance maybe www.loc.gov/pictures/resource/npcc.24323/ I'm not spending too much time on these portraits until the Sydney newspapers the Sunday Times and the Mirror are searchable to the end of the 1920s...they've evidently been scanned but it looks as if they're still being OCR'd...at present they stop at 1928 and 1925 respectively...both these newspapers are great sources for popular culture stuff and tabloid fare...
